Been to this place a few times already for the hookah. The hookah is pretty good. 4 starts because the food needs much improvement. The service is good. I would definitely return for the hookah.
Incredible food! Staff is very friendly and welcoming. I love it here. They always have a very relaxed vibe and guy makes the best hookah flavors.

This place is great! Came here for a quick lunch break for some hookah. The service was amazing! He was son top of it. Everything came so fast and the hookah was delicious! Also had the soccer game on the if screen which was just an added bonus for me! I got the hummus with the pita  bread and it had so much flavor to it too! I will for sure come here more often

Any quest to find a decent hookah lounge in this town is daunting. So few places get it right, and I have been all to often served up a $15 bowl of charcoal and ash.

Fortunately, Layla is one of the few lounges where the owners know what they are doing. The owners are nice and very attentive. They come by regularly with coals to and make sure you have everything you need.  A wide selection of flavors (Fumari, Starbuzz, Al Fakher and more) ensures that even the most discerning hookah smoker will find what they are looking for. The hookah was hitting great and service was on point.

The place is small but super clean. The lounge is really narrow but can accommodate large and small parties on their giant sofas. Though there isn't much flexibility in the seating, its comfortable and you can tell the owners care about keeping the place clean. The music on the night we went was awesome. Great mix of EDM, not sure if its the norm but 

They serve some food but the prices seem to be a bit high, few dishes below $10. We didn't order so I can't really comment if they are worth the price or not. Our server told us that they are going to be getting a liquor license soon which will definitely be a big plus as only a few lounges in town serve up alcohol.

Overall it was a great hookah experience and definitely one of the better lounges in town!
Yummy food and the staff are friendly. I always take my friends there just to chill, talk, eat, and smoke hookah.

I came in here about a month ago with my girlfriend after eating at Sushi Koma next door (which is an amazing sushi restaurant). We actually noticed the hookah lounge when we had first parked and knowing my obsession with having hookah after eating sushi, we decided to give it a try after we ate. 

First off, this place is very clean and very modern looking. It is nicely decorated and kinda gives you a lounge feel without being too dark and whatnot. This is also a restaurant so they have a counter and kitchen which you can see as you enter  but its really no big deal.

The couches are very comfortable in my opinion, and even though the suite is not that big, the couches and space for each table have a lot of leg room and whatnot. so that was a big plus as well.

Last and most importantly is the hookah. The hookah was hitting the whole time we were there and they have a variety of flavors. Being middle eastern, I am very picky regarding the whole hookah experience, from the coals to the flavor to the smoke produced. I'm really happy to say that this place got 3/3 for everything. 

The owner, Sean, is very chill and approachable. We mainly talked to his brother (which I forgot his name), but both were awesome and made sure we had a good experience. I definitely recommend this place to anyone for hookah and I would go a lot more often, but being in medical school kinda pre-occupies my life at the moment haha.

Oh and also, we didn't try the food since we were stuffed from the AYCE sushi next door, so next time we'll get some food and see how it is....but so far, 100% in my grade book!! haha

The best hummus I've ever had! Staff/management was truly awesome. You can really tell that the owners/staff take pride in this place. I had Greek salad and falafel hummus. Was more than enough for 2-3 sittings. I'll be back for sure!

Layla's is a good local hangout. Hookah, good food, big TVs, and nice atmosphere. We came on a Saturday night and ordered a hookah and some hummus with falafel. All in all, a fun night. A little expensive considering its off the strip at about $30 in total ($15/hookah), but I think it's a nice local hangout place that I'll bring some people in the future.

Go!  It's adorable with comfy couches and attentive owners/waiters who shower you with marinated, pickled vegetables and the most savory, textured hummus and pita bread like they have in Israel.  We only ordered drinks and our waiter brought out all of theses yummies.  Our drinks were large, potent and tasty!  According to the owner, it gets busy around 11PM - we were there around 6:30PM and had no trouble getting a table or getting served.  We'll be back!
Was so greasy my taste buds were out of the picture 3 bites in.  The obvious sign that i should have avoided was the fact that u can have schwarma with onion rings.  I would not order again.
I love this place for a late night meal. The music can get a bit loud, but it's good music and great atmosphere for a night with the girls or a quick date.

I've been to many hookah lounges, and on a Thursday night decided to check this place out. My overall experience here was great. The staff is professional, and the service is FAST. The lounge feels modern and they had comfortable seats. I ordered a pineapple mint hookah and their kabob. The hookah was great, and the kabob was the best I've had in any hookah lounge.Definitely coming back again.
Hookah is alright. Food is good. Asked for water but gave us bottled water and was charged for that. Customer service is not the best. But the fries are pretty good

This hookah was a face plant onto a curb with a fresh set of braces!! The only thing they had going for them was the music. I sent a hookah back because it lacked one of the most important things...flavor! I smoke hookah OFTEN and love pina colada flavor, when i ordered it at Layla's it taste like ear wax and plastic. 
Then, one of my friends requested a tap water because we weren't cool with paying $2.50 for a water, ad they refuse to give it to her...in which is illegal..
I can say i will never go back nor will i recommend.
Best hookah and customer service is amazing! So worth a night out here.  Also great music!

This is the place 2 come chill. Owners are super nice & the environment is unique. The prices for the hookah & kosher food are perfect. Drink selection is great. Would recommend for anyone looking for a chill night w/ friends.

the restaurant is very alive and clean. the owners are the best people around. don't even get me started about the food -- it's as authentic as it gets, like you're sitting in a restaurant in israel. a must for locals AND tourists! i always recommend this place.
We ordered the chicken sandwich and it was pretty good, but the service was so slow, surprisingly slow. I want to come back and give it another shot.
If you like good food and to get out off the strip that is the right place  great food and the karaoki nights always fun love it

Hidden gem at Las Vegas! I had the pleasure of finding this place this week that I've been in Las Vegas and it was outstanding.
The staff, the food and the environment! Great people and food.
Best Shawarma and absolutely best mushroom-hummus for a great price! Will sure be back soon!!!!

These guys are awesome, they're always pretty busy and I usually order online so sometimes I may have to wait a minute or two at the bar but they always greet you with a smile and a firm handshake and make sure to get you your order quickly. The falafel wrap is by far my favorite item on the menu- vegetarian or not I recommend it to everyone. They have lots of great appetizers as well like their onion rings and spring rolls. I'm not a huge fan of their schnitzel or shwarma chicken though, the schnitzel was somewhat dry and the shwarma is a tad oily but incredible people and atmosphere.

Maybe I was anticipating something else. I went there due to location to my place. Not that the food wasn't good, just wasn't what I expected. Service was good. Overall, the food was yummy. Why haven't I learned NOT to get Onion Rings to go?!?!?!? They never hold up.

Cozy hookah lounge perfect to hang with friends. Had some french fries that were pretty good and ordered a Long island iced tea, that didn't taste like a long island whatsoever, so I just asked for a Corona instead. Hookah was on point :)

Great hookah place amazing food 
Server was polite and nice 
My favorite was the ice hose with the lamb chop
Hummus and home made pita bread 
Works late night & weekend

My gf & I are always looking for Hookah spots. We look for best hooka prices & food options. We were first timers here. Place was pretty much empty but thats becasue we went around 3pm. The food menu was great. The service was great & the server was great. He was really fast with the hookah. Hate when we go somewhere & they take forever. I do recommend this place for locals. its a relaxing environment

Keep coming to this place and have to say everything is flawless. Great food, juicy fresh and best hookah. Two thumbs up guys. Wish you much success!!!

Roman

I was there this week....the food was amazing!!! Very nice atmosphere ... Nice music , defiantly be a regular spot!!!
Must visit.
I've never had hummus that didn't taste like hummus. Trashed it. Greasy oily food is a understatement. Stale fries. Everything was terrible... oh wait, except the snapple.
Great hookah, bar tender was so personable and made sure we were taken care of. Didn't get the chance to eat there but it's for sure a place for locals to go and have a good time off the strip.
The place has eveything liquor, beer, and of course hookah. See Sean at the bar he'll hook you up! The food is really good.

beat hookah lounch ever    i love their food. 
Noam and Sean served us. i like this place. we ate edamame as aperaizer and loved it.
Great place. Great food. Great people ... We ordered kabab and shawarma was great . Really recommend .
Amazon service, especially from Orel! Always a great time when I'm here. The hookah is amazing as usuals my favorite spot for hookah in Vegas!

Here for the first time for a friends birthday. The service was horrible. Literally waited bout twenty to thirty minutes just to get what we ordered. We tried to make the best of it but after taking so long waiting for our hookah my friend asked if it was coming. Since the music was loud the waitress told her you don't have to yell with an attitude. The music is loud we are trying to communicate and trying to enjoy our time but the service was ridiculous. I understand being busy but even for a water we waited a long time. Won't be coming back.

I finally understood what the Israelis were talking about when they said that there wasn't any good Shawarma in Vegas. This relatively new place gave me a taste of Israel. Definitely check it out. Best Israeli food in Vegas.
First visit, I found the menu rather limited and definitely not authentic to the Mediterranean  roots. Food was good though
I really enjoyed the place. Relaxing environment. Great food. Service was top notch.

Great place for hanging out and just relaxing with some friends, having some drinks and hookah. I went there before the remodel and thought it was great, and now it's even better. Much bigger inside and the redone interior is very classy and modern. They are prompt with replacing coals and don't use those nasty self lighting ones, they use actual coal. The pickled veggies there are the best and the food in general is excellent. I would recommend the place for good middle eastern food, even if you were not in the mood for hookah. The gentleman behind the counter who has been there every time (I get the impression he is the owner) is extremely friendly and accommodating.

The BEST food I've ever ate in my life!! It has so many options there that anyone can eat there.
The staff were very kind and nice. 
The place looks beautiful, big and very nice to sit there with friends any time of the day. 
I will definitely go back to this place to eat and hang out with friends !!
Best place and great food!

It took me a while to find it tucked away in a strip mall but as I have discovered with so many places in Vegas, appearances can be deceiving!  

I walked in way overdressed after coming from dinner where my dining companion bailed on me so I ate alone (nothing gets between me and great food!) and decide to just continue with our plans by myself.  Admittedly, I was a bit uncomfortable walking int a Hookah lounge by myself because I don't smoke and it was out of the norm for me. (Restaurants I know my way around... this was all new!)

Fortunately, I can have some big brass ones so I just tucked them in and opened that door.  I looked around and it seemed like a combination of a small bar with food and then upholstered benches (like sofas but not quite) with a pair of seating areas facing each other and a coffee table in between.  As I gazed around a couple of (Do we call them Hookahers?) invited me to sit across from them.  Obviously they sensed I was a little uncomfortable.  I was grateful!

The server immediately came up, made me feel comfortable, explained things to me and as a non-smoker what might be too harsh, etc.   I decided on chocolate and almost instantly out came the pipe.  I made a joke about being old enough to know a big bong when I see it and he laughed and said "don't inhale so deep and don't hold it in" and I laughed with him.  (wink, wink)

I actually found it very pleasurable and relaxing.  It didn't make me sick to my stomach like when I have tried cigarettes!

It's hard not to patronize a place with such pleasant people.  I am definitely going to give it a second try with a group of people and have some food this time.

The worst Mediterranean food that we ever eat.
Hummus is oily and it's not even close to real hummus.
Chicken was like a chewing gum or maybe even close to rubbe taste ... fat and just very very bad.
We order fries they send us rice complete mess one more restaurant that just charge for shi*.
You can get even 1 % value for your money.

Layla's is a great place . The atmosphere is very relaxing . The music is amazing but it's great that you can hear each other and can talk to your friends. Hookah is amazing and the guys there have a great service , always smiling and treating customers friendly . It's always a pleasure to visit Layla's .

#1  plays I recommend to go to
The food is great 
You want to try shoarma pita or bagget 
We love this plays ......:::::))))))))

Came in here on a very slow night, attentiveness was zero. We got a "I'll be with you" then no one came back to help us. We immediately left. I do not like the layout of this place and the service was totally absent. Guess I must have walked in on a bad night.
Cool atmosphere, good hookah and good food every time! & they serve alcohol, good mixed drinks!! Baklava is awesome also! Will be back!

Hookahs here are terrible. It tastes burnt and hits your throat right from the START. It feels like they don't wash their hookahs or just don't know how to pack it but regardless you should be able to taste the flavor you choose, not just a burnt flavor. The hookahs here used to be decent but now it's garbage. If you want a GOOD hookah experience I recommend Luna Hookah Lounge of Olive Hookah Lounge. For $18 you'll get a MUCH better hookah. 

As for the food here, it's not bad. It's good food but it's over-priced. 12-13 for a sandwich. Again though it's worth it if you're feeling the food. 


I'm more than willing to change this review if their hookahs become better. Nobody wants to pay $18 to smoke a hookah that's un-smokable. 

As a hookah lounge you guys should be serving 
1. Well packed hookahs
2. In premium hookahs
3. With good tobacco
4. And in clean hookahs. 

After that you need to make sure you guys are using the right amounts of tobacco and the right hookah bowls. Again, this used to be our favorite hookah place, you guys used to serve good hookahs so I'm sure you know how to fix this.

I forgot how good this place really is. Went there for dinner with my with my brother who was in town. As soon as I opened the door I was surprised they expanded.. Now it's twice the size and it looks a lot better. I had the shish kabob which was excellent my bro had the chicken which was equally as good. Also had the hummus and the falafel again excellent. 

I will coming here more often

I'm gonna give this place a five star review!  Because it's one of the most amazing place I've ever been to, the service was perfect the sound and the Dj are deferent than other places in Vegas and give you a really good feeling and keep you awake.  The service is very friendly and they treat you like they know you.   It's fun.   Shahar was super nice and made us feel comfortable.   Looks like they expending now.  Nice..

First time being came with my cousin as we looked on yelp for good reviews. And I can say is was just as expected. Great! They were all very helpful one helping us with what to order , helped fix the hookah if it got harsh and even got complimentary French fries. Loved this place for a nice lay back spot to eat and smoke (:

Have been here 3 times now and every time was good. Food was really good, hookah was great. The staff is very personable. Seems like they have a lot of regulars which is always  a good sign. Would recommend as a cool hang out spot to grab food and chill out if you are looking for something low key.

Love ittttt....!! It's my home a way from home. Food is great people are great. It's always clean and the staff are super nice and helpful ;) I recommend the lentil soup, Falafel wrap and Geffen leaves filled with rice.. So yummy! Great options for Vegans
Amazing food and great serVice! It's a smaller local restaurant with authentic food! The atmosphere is great and the drinks are even better! This is a place I will definitely be returning to!
Cheap liquor, decent crowd. EXTREMELY dirty and unsanitary. They took forever to bring drinks unfriendly staff. Hope to have a better experience next time.
This is good hookha place in town I ve ever been. Nice stuff and I got nice service from the guy name Nitzah . He is awesame and the best service ever

I have been to many hookah lounges, and this one is hands down the cleanest. Layla's has awesome food and drinks. The hookah is great too, they have many common classic flavors as well as their own twists. The customer service is amazing too. Always tending to the coals and making sure you're good on food and drink. It's a must try!

saw the reviews thought it was gonna be cool, but terrible service. The only person that cared about my party was the Busser and he was super busy. The servers were terrible. Didn't check on the table at all. Won't be going back anytime soon.
AMAZING! We had such a wonderful experience tonight. Great atmosphere, service, hookah, and coffee!! Didn't get a chance to try the food but will be back! Thank you for the hospitality tonight!

Best hookah bar hand down in la vegas. The owners and the staff have amazing customer service and the quality of hookah is outstanding. I highly recommend this place to smoke peacefully or have few drinks with friends at night.

I was at this spot yesterday with my family for brunch and drinks.   We were surprised by the big and verey menu they offer.   They have mostly Mediterranean food and also have some Asian and American food options.  The food was great and comes is big plates and big portions.  Everything was fresh and nice and tasty.    They serve all the best brand names of alcohol and give good deals for shots and for beer buckets.   The prices are reasonable and the atmosphere there is super cool and fun.   We will be back.
One of my favor place when I need my own space. Great service, delicious tea choices and hookah selections. Music too loud that's one thing disappointing me.
Pretty cool place more of a low key hookah lounge that you just want to chill at. Wasn't overly impressed by the tobacco or the coals used. Smoked for a while but when it burnt it burnt bad.

omg i love layla's. super chill spot, good food, good selection of alcohol, and they have good hookah!!!! that lasts & hits good. & everything is reasonably priced! this is my go to when i just want to be chill and visit with friends, its kind of out of the way for me now (i used to live right by it) but its definitely worth it. oh yiahhh and i love the music they play, always on point.

i forgot to add how nice the staff is !! hello lol

Definitely check this place out. Great vibe, great owners, GREAT FOOD! Everything is made in house. The hummus and pita bread was great, schwarma was very tasty, and a huge selection of alcoholic beverages. Great for lunch or for a lounge atmosphere with a few late night comrades. 

Thank you guys! Keep it up. Can't wait to see what the future holds. 
Zak

I come here all the time I'm actually a regular ! 
The staff actually became my friends ! They are very friendly and good service. The food awesome !  Also a bar which is fun. A older crowd , which is nice. The hookah here is phenomenal compared to the other hookah places I've been too. I'm a big hookah fan. So this is my go to place. Hope it will be your too! Come check it out !!

This place is good, the food is good and the atmosphere is good. The plates are very big two people could eat off one plate.
Just like I said the atmosphere here is so good. The owner is so nice. The food is sooooiooo good stuff many things to pick from.
I loveee Layla's!! Great vibe, good staff, good hookah, young crowd at night and older more mature crowd in the afternoon.

Great service, food & hookah! All 65 flavors are great.   I also had the soup of the day, it was a great lentil soup. The alcohol is good and fair prices. The also have a happy hour. This is the place to be.

My friend and I came in late night past 12am on a Sunday looking for a low-key setting to smoke hookah and have a few drinks. Al and Nitzan greeted us with a warm welcome and assisted us right away. They recommended their house blend and it was fantastic! They came by regularly to to change our coal and refill our water. This has since become our go to hangout spot after work! They also have a special of 5 shots of patron for $15!
We love this place. My wife and I go every week for Hookah and dinner. The staff is friendly, good music choice, clean, delicious foods, and the hookah is awesome. Definitely a must try.

Superb place!!! Every staff is very accommodating to your needs. Super friendly and the vibe is chill with good music. Coworkers and I had fun but were still able to hear our conversations. For Hookah flavor i highly recommenf the SKYMIX!! Didn't get to try the food but definitely will be coming back. Highly recommend Layla's Hookah Bar and Lounge.

This is out spot for hookah and drinks in Las Vegas.  Steal and Sean will take care of you.   The food is great and they use kosher meat so it's good for us.   They open every day. All day.  They have a deal for five shots for 18 dollar.    The atmosphere is great.     Everyone is friendly there and they are busy most of the time.   We defiantly coming back.
Whoever on the aux, sucks. They play music then all of a sudden, *moment of silence.* staff is cool though. Lol

Food was excellent. Ate lunch here today and had my first hookah as well. The owner was attentive and even gave me hummus on the house because I'm not big on this type of food. Then he set me up with a good starter hookah blend and even got the hookah started well for me.

Really enjoyed the experience and will definitely be back.
I've been here three times so far and I keep coming back. They have a very nice lounge area that is chilled and laid back. The food is great and they have tons of hookah flavors to pick from.

Absolutely love this place. I would come here almost every weekend with one of my closest friends. Their hookah is amazing, always smooth. The staff is great and knowledgable about hookah and smoking. 
We only came here to smoke, but their menu looks delicious. 
Since we used to be somewhat of "regulars" they served us a plate of fries on the house - how lovely of them and the fries were great!

Overall, I love this place and simply wish I had the time to visit more frequently!

I came here to celebrate my birthday it was my first time to a hookah lounge in Vegas and the hookahs were horrible. It just tastes like they don't clean the pipes and I was ghosting other flavors. The costumer service was awful, we sat down for maybe 25 minutes before I had to walk up to the bar and ask if we order up there because we weren't checked on or anything. The only good thing about this place is the music. Can't wait to go back to Stratosphere and get great costumer service and great pipes. Hate this place.

We found Layla by accident. We tried to go to Sweet & Spicy, right across the street, and they were closed for maintenance. Cue Yelp. Layla was right across the street. Even better for our night owl eating habits, it was still open, and stays open past 2:00 a.m. Perfect!

It may have a different, more brightly lit, ambiance during the day, when our waiter, Nis... (can't remember it exactly) said that it's busy with people eating. At this hour, most customers were here for the hookah; that may explain why the music was so loud. I love any music with a beat, even hip hop, which was part of the mix. But the booming bass made conversation difficult when that genre was playing. That won't stop us from coming back, because the food was absolutely delicious! 

I didn't try Shakshuka when I was in Israel, and I have a lot of recipes for it; but I don't do a lot of cooking, so I was thrilled to see it on the menu and get to try it for the first time. It was listed under the Breakfast heading, but that didn't matter. We decided to share that, along with a Sabih sandwich. Our waiter patiently explained the veggie combinations in that big sandwich, and it sounded differently delicious. And both items were just that: the smoky tomato-based vegetables were the perfect base for the eggs nestled on top. I'm already craving it again. The sandwich was unusual, but in a good way; a little messy, but he noticed and was quick to bring more napkins. We're not vegetarians, but I Iuvvv vegetables, so both items we ordered were beyond excellent.

Though I'm from the generation that started it all, and can't say that I "didn't inhale," I really wasn't familiar with the mechanics of the hookah. That was remedied when our waiter sat down and gave me a full lesson! 

Finding Layla was serendipitous, and we're glad we did. Shakshuka is calling my name!
They give good service! Been coming here every other week! Stella's awesome thank you for showing us a good time!

Came here after I got some coffee next door with my buddy. Noam greeted us as soon as we came in which is awesome. We came here with the intention of only smoking some hookah. Then I got a beer, which you don't find at all hookah lounges. Noam then joked about his hummus being the best in Vegas so we had to give it a try. To our suprised the hummus and falafel is definitely the best falafel I've had in the country I would definitely recommend coming here either if you want a quick drink, a bite to eat, hookah or all three at once! It's a place to bring a date or friends.

Great food, friendly staff, yummy hookah, chill crowd and did I say Great food? They have a Ton of vegan options and the drinks are a great price too! I ordered the onion rings, Greek salad, falafel balls and my friend for the teriyaki chicken! My friend loved her food! And I LOOOOOOOOOOVED mine, everything was on point. I asked for something fruity but not too strong and the hookah was perfect. I ordered 5 shots of peach ciroc for $18 to share wth my friend. I'll definitely be back

The gentlemen that helped us was very friendly. I have been there a few times & have enjoyed their drinks & hookah, but my last visit didn't yield the same results as my other visits.

I had a mojito which tasted more like spiked water & the first bowl of hookah we had kept getting harsh. We had it for about 15 minutes until we requested a different bowl of shisha. I thought it was odd that I was still charged for the first bowl even though we kept having a lot of problems with it. At other hookah places I've gone to, if I was having problems with the bowl I wouldn't be charged for it, so I did find that rather odd. I probably caught them on an off-day because I've never had a problem with their hookah getting harsh fast. The second bowl we received was perfect, so the first one was probably a fluke.

Customer service is great. Their food is great as well. I'll probably go again. The atmosphere is pleasant & they play great music.

Came in here not knowing what to expect! But what can I say, very excellent customer service. Had Shawama and it was amazing! Nizan the Manager great guy and makes you feel like you are the best customer. 

Nice and dim with alot of seating so great for groups. Lots of flavors and familiar names. So if you wanna eat and relax i suggest to come here.

I heard this was a place where you could get Middle Eastern Cuisine, so I thought I would give it a try. I love Lebanese food and I have not found a place on the West Coast that knows how to make shawarma. I was hoping this place did...nope. First of all you need to have the machine to rotate and cook the lamb. The meat does not taste the same on the grill. Then you need to have a panini grill to toast the sandwich after you roll it up. I still have to go back to Dearborn, Michigan to get a good shawarma sandwich.

That being said, I will say they have a cool little hookah lounge. They have nice drink menu and food menu as well. Don't get me wrong, the food was good. I just want a real shawarma sandwich!! I think the owners are Israeli, so that would explain the different style of some of the cooking. They make shawarma sandwiches way different. The food is going to vary from country to country in the Middle East, but it's all basically the same stuff.

Anyways, the place looked clean and the food is good. I would recommend trying it out.

Without a doubt the best hookah café in Vegas. Shisha is always good and made to order, not ever premade. 

All the staff is courteous and attentive. Ask for Nitzan, Guy, or Sean and they will definitely treat you right. 

Food is fresh and tasty and reasonably priced with very large portions. 

Environment is always welcoming to everyone so it's no wonder they are always full and need to expand. 

Caution: if you want a nice quiet hookah avoid their karaoke nights on Tuesday cause it gets a little crazy. 

PS make sure to tip the busboys VG, Big G, and Mr.A  well cause they work their tails off!!! 

I come back here whenever I'm in Vegas!

This place deserves more than 5 stars! The staff is amazing-- friendly, attentive and professional for such a chill place.  I'm normally not a hookah kinda girl, but the bowls here are so smooth and tasty it's kind of hard to puff-puff pass.  I love that they play great hip-hop and R&B-- which is so hard to find nowadays in an industry of "unce-unce" house music. 

The food is bomb as hell. Chicken wings for the win, hummus, and other tapas. Definitely recommend people to hit up especially on a weekday.

We were there a couple of weeks ago and unfortunately the service and food was horrible! 
One guy was doing it all.. when we finally got the food, it was under cooked and not once did someone approached us to ask if everything is ok.
I'll not go there again, plenty of other options for me in Vegas.

Came with my family for a lunch....
What can I say food is gr8 service was quick and elegant.
When I came with my 2 kids there were no Hookahs lit so that was good!!!

Great pricing, great service and the best from all factors was the music...
God bless bob Marley

A majority of my friends have been spilling the deets on this place for three years. THREE. I finally gave in today and although I don't do hookah, this is apparently the place to do it. The service is *two thumbs up* - I came in looking for my friend and even though the owner? worker? was serving someone else, he still made me feel as though I was his only customer and said a friendly hello! 

Our party of three ordered falafel & hummus (which includes pita) + Greek salad + mint lemonade (bomb!) + onion rings/French fries. 

I won't comment on the onion rings/French fries cause those were pretty standard imo, but the Greek salad and the mint lemonade is what is going to have me coming back. 

Mint Lemonade: freaking authentic  mint leaves. lemonade. not overly sweet, but sweet enough that my mouth is watering for some of this gloriousness. tastes so damn good I ordered a second one and slurped it up probably quicker than the first. #thethirtisreal 
But don't take my word for it, GO EXPERIENCE IT FOR YOURSELF...then come thank me ;) 

Greek Salad: I went CHOPPED. It was terminology I hadn't heard of before, but I chose chopped because it sounded like the salad parts would be in smaller pieces...and I was right. They don't go light on the feta and I salute them.
Felt like I was smoking hookah in my garage. Horrible decor, mediocre hookah. Definitely better options in the surrounding area. Our server was difficult to understand.

I tried most the hookah lounges and this one is the best!!
 also the food is amazing Everything is worth a try,..

First time at Layla , the food was amazing with great customer service. I recommend this place to everyone, a must try for Hookah and Israeli food lovers. The only reason the place did not get 5 stars is do to the size of restaurant. But over all a great place to have a bite.

I loved Layla's the service was excellent very personal and attentive! The hookah is good as well as the food. We tried a few different food items such as the sampler plate I think it was called with couscous and French fries lol my favorite thing was the chicken shawarma. Surprisingly they had awesome chicken fingers also. We will
Definitely be back soon!

Yelp you have failed me. I saw 4.5 stars and i thought I'd give Layla Grill a try. I ordered the chicken shawarma, beef kabob, and chicken steak. None of the food was what it was suppose to be and it was extremely salty and greasy. I literally could not eat the food even though i was starving! I should've just went to McDonald's smh
I've been coming to this place since it first opened. Excellent food and hookah! Guy and his staff are always aiming to please whoever walks through their door!

I'm not from this neck of the woods, but when I came into town my lovely lady (Jenny L.) recommended we come here, and boy was I impressed!

First and foremost, a monumental shout out to the folks that work here. We had a gal, Stella, helps us out last night and she was quite attentive in bringing us coals and asking on how we were doing, keep it up girl! We also had a gentleman who was incredibly friendly in telling us what he had to offer in terms of hookah flavors. In the end, we got the house special, and we stuck with it a few times, it is very good! The place itself has good alcohol specials as well if you want to get your drink on. The music there is also pretty good; they play some top 40 stuff as well as some classics in terms of hip hop and R&B as well as some dance. The place itself is also cozy, they have pillows availible to make yourself that extra bit comfortable. Last but not least, the food. I got a pita with falafels and it was the bees knees. 

Overall; I was throughly impressed with everything from the food, to the hookah and most importantly the customer service. Next time we're in town, we'll stop by to our hookah place away from home.
Our server, Guy, was excellent. Burger and shawarma was very good...highly reccomended for any occasion.
I love the food! Shawarma wrap is different compared the the usual shawarma I had in the past. Uniquely good. Service is awesome. Our server is very pleasant and knowledgeable about the food.

Best hookah and grill in Vegas period no other hookah lounge has been able to top it! I've come here for 3 years straight and not once had a bad experience. Awesome owners, great employees, and best hookah. Weekdays are chiller which I like but weekends can get crazy fun. I usually go alone but they have space to have bigger groups hang out too.

Another amazing shawarma dinner with incredible salad and the best amba in town. This restaurant is so clean and beautiful inside. The atmosphere and environment is so welcoming. The owner Guy Kam is such a pleasant amazing person. Thank you for such a fantastic meal. This will always be my favorite Israeli restaurant ever

Layla is by far one of the best hookah lounges in town. Their customer service is by far one of the best I've ever received anywhere. I love all of their hookah flavors and we come pretty regularly for it. They also have a large variety of alcohol, which is always a plus from beers to liquor. Also, their food is pretty bomb! My favorite is their chicken sharwarma. Either as a dinner platter or as a baguette sandwich with hummus, hot sauce and cabbage. Not a fan of those? There's a large variety of things to add into your sandwich and platters according to your tastes. The atmosphere is also very lounge like, seats are extremely comfortable and can accommodate large parties. It's pretty hard to find a clean, nice and relaxing hookah lounge that has good flavors and smoke, and the major +'s is this place also has amazing food, ALCOHOL, and superior service.
Yummy food, friendly service,  super chill ambiance,  & tasty hookah! :) AND late nite hours!!

The first time being here, a friend and I were eating sushi right next door and she wanted to smoke hookah so we came. It was during the day super chill and relaxing. The hookah is decent but not amazing. It got harsh really quick, a good hookah session should last at least an hour before getting so harsh, this lasted for about 30 minuets maybe they don't use good coals? I came here again last week on a weekend and it was busy so the service was a little slow, I ordered a Long Island and it tasted terrible. I was disappointed with my last visit. They get all there stars from me solely based on there food which is delicious. My friend got there fried fish and that was good. I always get mozzarella sticks they're my fav! I've order from here on Uber Eats before I Love there Wings with ranch! The food is always a hit but they should have a couple more people working inside on the weekends. Also they stay open pretty late till 2 which is good.

Awesome! Great experience! Came here with my Mom and my sister, and we all loved it! The service was amazing (Guy is da bomb) and the food and hookah is even better! I got the falafel and hummus appetizer and just that was seriously soooo good!! Also the pina colada hookah was nice :) I love this place, you've gotta give it a try! :)
Great food especially enjoyed the hummus and kabobs.  The apple hooka was great as well.  Will go again when back in Vegad...
Best hookah place I've been to so far. The service was great the hookah was great, good vibes. I'll definitely come back :)

I come here all the way from the strip for their hummus and mushrooms. If you are a fan of Mediterranean food you will love this place. I'm not a person who loves to write reviews but because of how much this place impresses me every time, I decided they deserve a great review. Their plates are huge and well worth the prices

Layla Grill and Hookah is my favorite lounge. The customer service is amazing! The diversity of the environment is my favorite thing about Layla's. Many types of people come into Layla's to socialize and have a good time! Drinks are always perfect and the music is bomb!
Love this spot.  Great little hang out. Calm, relaxing with awesome music. Definitely one of my favorites
First time here and we had a great time! Great atmosphere and amazing service from Noam! Will be coming here again :) try the watermelon kiwi mint hookah flavor.

Great food and service, which are two aspects that truly make this a noteable place to experience.  I had the falafel which brought me back to my time in NYC.  The staff was amazing in terms of of how friendly and helpful the are.  I will definitely be back!

From L.A went there Tuesday and Wednesday I might go again tomorrow. I might even move to Vegas just for this place. Best humus and pita, well, I think I have to go tomorrow, I need to try humus and falafel and maybe something else. It's 2:26 am and I'm hungry.
This place is awesome!

I love this place, make it a point to come here at least once whenever I'm in town.

1) The customer service is EXCELLENT! The staff are always insanely friendly and attentive.  My glass never hits empty before I'm asked if I'm all set or if I need another, but there's never any pressure to keep buying or drinking.  They aren't at all pushy or overbearing.  Sit for an hour puffing a hookah with a bottle of water and they're totally cool.

2) The hookahs are damn good.  These guys know how to keep just the right amount of continual coal on top without charring or getting harsh.  Pick a new flavor and just dont like it....they will replace it without batting an eye.

3) This was my first time in since they remodeled and its beautiful.  The venue now matches the quality of the service and product.  Comfy couches, very open and the air handling keeps the place clear and fresh, even with a room full of hookhas burning away.

4) The hummus and pitas (all I've ever had here) are excellent, fresh, and the perfect accoutrements to the well made drinks.

If you've never tried a hookah, check the place out!  Great for a midday break or to start/end a night with your friends.

Layla Grill and Hookah may seem like a weird combination, but trust me, this works!!

New to the area, my brother suggested this spot... He knows how I love (And need) my Hummus and Pita fix!!
It was a long day involving new home decor chores and so it was just perfect!!

Really cool vibe, amazing customer service and the food.. MmmHmmm, spot on!! Great variety, awesome quality.. I cannot wait to be back!!

Very good prices and amazing food I go there at least twice a week because of the amazing service and the fair prices.  Love it.
They have 68 Hookah flavors.

I've been to Layla a few times and have never really settled on whether I liked it or not. 

The hookah has always just been ok, but the bowls are always over packed. The coal replenishment sucks and they constantly being out small, half used coals. I've never been able to enjoy a bowl for more than 45 minutes. The last visit no one checked on us for coals or food, we just had to walk to the bar.

I will say that they have some of the best hummus I've had though. The food seems pretty too notch all the way around.

The one reason that I have officially decided not to go there anymore is the music. This place is too God Damn small to have music that Damn loud. I might as well go alone because we have never been able to have a conversation there. Last night I left with a splitting head ache and I could feel my ears pulsing and throbbing. On top of the noise, the music they play is Shit. You just can't go there and chill.

So to break it down: Mediocre bowls, good food, weak enviornment, loud as Fuck.

I love this place, the service is excellent and the food is delicious.
I will definitely recommend this place and for sure come back again.
Don't forget to finish your dinner with their great hookah and tea.
Enjoy
This is one of my top 3 restaurants in the city! Best schnitzel and hummus! My fiance and I go often!

Nice lounge with great customer service from a guy named AL. He is attentive and our hookah was amazing.Unlike other places you go to this place was relaxing and roomy and comfy for our group of 5. We ordered drinks and food and got great service. If you want to go to a great hookah lounge this is the place you should go to don't waste your time and money anywhere else. In this place you will get your money worth.
Cheap, hookahs as lights, creative hookahs to smoke from and lots of different beers. Really clean and intimate as well. Have yet to try the food but it smells great
Really good experience! Hookah flavors are good. Food is good. Ambiance is comfy and very relaxed. Also has a tabletop bar. I will coming back. Highly recommend coming here if you want a good hookah!

horrible music , low music , they just need to change the playlist. They've played the same songs multiple times and they even got me into my feelings with some simp songs. I came to get hype and be able to enjoy my night but instead I thought of my ex.

On our Vegas trip we stopped here cause we love hooka and Mediterranean food. With all the five stars we figured we hit the jackpot.  When we walked in the place looked very nice and clean ,  but not at all restaurant style more like a lounge with couches and coffee tables. I hesitated to order food so we decided to start with appetizers, and as the server bragged about the hummus and falafel we figured we give it a shot. Well very disappointing the hummus had no flavor and falafel were saggy. So we decided to pass on the main dish. Hooka were k but little pricy for Vegas $18 I THINK NOT!!!!! NOT even here in SF cost that much. Well I wish them luck but will try our luck somewhere else next time. As they say in Vegas you lose some you win some , we lost this time maybe will win next time .
The muthafuckin Baklava!!!!!!OMG  sole reason I come here ion even smoke hookah but the BEST baklava hands down yo!

I don't smoke Hookah but my adult kids do so when they came to visit they wanted to go and this one happened to be open earlier than others closer to home so off we went.
They said the Hookah was just OK compared to other places but not bad.  The price was a little higher but the service was super fast and they were very friendly.  I only give four stars due to what they stated about the flavor of the Hookah and the price.  However, I did order the cheese sticks which were only $5 so that was cheap and although I have a feeling they were just frozen cheese sticks they were actually really good and I meant to ask them what brand they were.  They only have hot black tea and hot green tea which is another reason we would have preferred another spot that had better options for that.  Overall, if the kids wanted to go earlier in the day again we would go to this spot due to the service, the hours and maybe appetizers.  The waiter even showed interest in the card game we were playing.  Just being nice but he didn't just walk by us and ignore his table with the two young adults playing cards with their mom in his section.
i wouldn't even give this place one star, the food was disgusting and had a hair in it, and we had got a hookah and it was burnt and asked for another and that was burnt too. Disappointed.

I go to Layla's for lunch every once in a while...it's always well worth the trip...there's no Mediterranean food like Layla's. The shawarma is wonderful, the various appetizers such as baba ganoush are delicious: find out the daily special at lunch - I've always enjoyed them. I appreciate the care taken by the owners... :)
the tomato bean soup is ok. the hummus is basically inedible. such a weird consistency for hummus, too dense. the taste is super bland as well. do not go here if you want a good hummus.
This is the best place for hookah in las vegas. I enjoy this place over and over. Extremely helpful stuff and  great food too.

Absolutely shocked with how bad the food tasted. The server was nice, but the place was dark. Not only as it pertains to the light, but also just the feeling. I won't be back. I was here about two years ago and the food was much better. It does get a lot of positive reviews, so I may have just hit them on a bad day. I'm not going to give it another try though.

The food is the best food i have ever ate, the price is good refers to what you get. The service is kind and you feel like a VIP guest. We ordered the Pargiot and the Schnitzel and it was amazing.
One of the most joy-able places i have been at.
This place is awesome, staff is so sweet and loving, food and hookah is stellar !!! This place is so versatile, it can be a party or a kickback, either way it is awesome, drinks are awesome also!! (:

The best hookah lounge I've been in Vegas. Amazing employees, plays the best songs, hookah flavors always the best. If u don't know what hookah flavor to get, asked them to make one for you and it's always the best. Me and my friends always have a blast here. Love their steak and Lamb chops.

Came here tonight based off yelp reviews. When we got there all the tables were taken so they offered us seats at the bar while we wait for a table to open up. After about 10 mins later a table left but they said it was reserved so we would get the next table. Another pair came in after us and sat at the bar. The reserved table has still not been occupied and it had been about half an hr now. 2 more tables open up and they give the reserved table to the couple who had walked in after us. Maybe the employees knew them but they weren't the ones with reservations so it was BS that they got a table before we did. We were so disappointed we didn't even finish our meal or hookah. and trust me we have already spent a good amount on alcohol, food, and hookah.Don't plan on coming back here and its a shame cause the food was good.
Really good hookah and drinks. Nizon was an excellent host/server ask for him when you come and he will take great care of you. Good music and atmosphere.

I asked for double apple and hint of mint, it was good. But food, from Middle Eastern point of view, it wasn't good, shawarma was so salty. Server was nice and respectful. Overall, okay to check it out if you are craving hookah in Vegas.
Sean and Al are the BEST! Awesome ass service and they take care of you. Sean ESPECIALLY is super sweet. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is AMAZING. I highly recommend.
Super Slow service, decent hookahs (7/10), good food (American & Arabic) , good music (mostly hiphop) . Good environment overall, super chill spot.
Nice low-key, laid back, good food ( mozzarella sticks ), good hookah flavors, good music...my new favorite late night spot!

I went to Layla Grill & Hookah last night for the first time and was soooo happy with the food drinks, and service! Sean was great and made us feel welcome right when we walled through the door! We went with the blue mist hookah and it was delish not the mention sooo smooth! My husband ordered the falafel sandwich and loved it and a friend was also happy with the chicken teryaki. Sean and the other servers were super cool and the place was nice and comfortable, overall we had a wonderful night and will definitely be back! :)

This past January marked a year my wife stopped smoking cigarettes.  So imagine my surprise when the one thing she wanted to do to mark the occasion was to...smoke hookah??  I personally hadn't done that in well over 6+ years.  28 reviews and counting with consistent 5 star reviews lead us to Layla.

Although it's a small place that can cater to maybe 6 groups total, it's like a really cool guy's basement.  That really cool guy happens to also be named Guy.  He recognized my wife and I instantly since we lived in the same apartment complex a couple of years ago and had neighboring parking spots.  Throughout our visit, Guy was super friendly, attentive and made us feel very welcome.  The big leather couches you sit on INSIST that you stay a while.       

We were informed that all their food was homemade so trying the falafel and hummus appetizer was an absolute must for me.  Their falafel rivals any other joint as the best in LV, crunchy outside and flavorful green inside.  I could tell right away that the hummus was homemade.  It tasted more like a super thick tahini sauce than your average hummus but I thought it accompanied the falafel really well.  I'll be sure to get it again.  We also got an order of stuffed grape leaves and a nice basket of freshly toasted pita.  Guy also hooked us up with a couple of pieces of baklava which made for a nice ending to the meal.

Hookah time.  Lots of choices and my wife chose their "pina colada" which was fine and tasted as advertised.  3 bricks would have been enough for 4-6 people to smoke let alone two.

Count on me as a repeat customer!  At the very least I'll order their great Middle Eastern food to go since they're open so late or we'll lounge out the next time my wife has "the itch".

This is my spot, I'm a regular here. Best quality hookah you'll find in Vegas. 5 for $15 any kind of shots? Yeah best deal youll find ever. The staff is extremely friendly. The food is great as well. Amazing fries & falafels. The environment is dope you can go and study earlier in the day and by night it's poppin. Older in age type of scene which is a plus, unlike other lounges they're ratchet. 10/10

We tried another hookah lounge while we were out in Las Vegas this past week and although Layla Grill & Hookah is a ways from the strip- where we were staying at (MGM) the hookah was good (I got blue mist, red gummy, white gummy, lemon mint) and so were the appetizers (chicken strips with sesame seeds & edamame) and drinks. This was our FIRST time at this hookah lounge!

Al was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the environment & Al made you feel at home and welcomed from the moment you walked in. We had great conversations with Al and he knows a lot about hookah and the different flavors and what pears good with them. We are no beginners ourselves so it was good to know the man that was helping us knew what he was doing as well.

Al took care of us and handled everything we wanted and needed perfectly. Al is a great worker and we are happy to have had him assist us since our experience at Luna Lounge the night before was a bit disappointing. 

We will definitely be back to visit the next time we are in Las Vegas!
I have to say the hamburger here is juicy and tasty.   The taste of shawarma is almost as good as the one at N Miami Beach one.

Al is my dude here, from the first time I went there he showed GREAT service and attention to customers. This place has moved into my top 3 spots for hanging out, heck it was even going down on a Monday lol
We came in late night for drinks, didn't smoke Hookah but service was good.

I always come here for food pick up and tonight i came with my friends and decided to dine in.  we were surprised by how fun this place is.   they made us feel welcome and comfortable. they gave us bug selection of alcohol and hookah flavors.

Great food, good service, awesome atmosphere and of course the hookah is perfect! Just saved layla grill and hopkah into my favorites in my GPS.
Will definitely recommend to all my friends too!  (-:
Best Middle Eastern food and Hookah in Vegas! Excellent staff. Everyone is extremely friendly. They are the best! Highly recommend Layla Grill & Hookah!

Stella helped us out and her customer service EVER! 
Definitely recommend coming here! The prices are cheap, hookah is perfect, food is good! 
18+ LOUNGE!!!

Biting on town for the week.  
We've all over the city but this was the best time we've had! It's a really nice place with good atmosphere and service.   Can't go wrong.

This place is my go to spot for in need of hookah flavors.
Due to other smoke shops closing very earlier. They open Til 2:30am and when I need flavors I go here. They offer 100mg for about $6.71. I believe the brand is star buzz.

I haven't hungout in this place to smoke hookah since I have my own. But I'm willing to come to this place just to kick it Becuase they play really good music.

Always a great time at LAYLA. The food is phenomenal,  the drinks are superb,  and the hookah is 'fresh'. The atmosphere here is always wonderful weather you're here during the day,  night, or after a club/party to unwind. Thank you Shahar for your constant hospitality!
Nice atmosphere for a hookah lounge with great hookahs and service.  Food is good too!

Super chill place to bring a couple of friends. The food was good, the hookah is good, prices aren't crazy, and the atmosphere is relaxing. The waiters are extraordinarily friendly and always want to make sure that you're tended to, which is always pleasant.

What a great restaurant. The owners Shahar and Hagai will do whatever it takes to make you happy. My favorite dish is the chicken breast salad with tahini! Awesome food, great customer service - if you're into Mediterranean food and hookah, this is the place to go!

Very chill atmosphere and it gets busy later at night. They need more staffs for faster service. The hookah is great. Good quality. They have good deal on all of the double shots $5 except for Hennessy. Haven't tried their food but my friend said the lamb is excellent.
I liked the place and service was good too. I had  falafel which I would say is one of the best in town.

Very nice joint to smoke Hookah and just kick back. Lots of space to find seating and just relax. The staff was very helpful and the place was very neatly organized. They have a big projector and comfy couches to enjoy your hookah.

The menu has a wide variety of Hookah flavors. Once you take a seat they bring you a side of pretzels and a water. The staff was very fast and they make sure to check on you to make sure everything is going good. Ordered items was the blueberry and orange flavored hookah. Everything was great!

Overall great place to come smoke hookah. The thing that stood out was the great customer service. The guy gave us pretzels and waters and then constantly checked on us.

Excellent hookah and food service. I haven't been impressed with hookah lounge services in ages! 

Loved the ambience of this place. Great music and great food. Wasn't planning on ordering anything else besides hookah, but my friend who recommended me this place told me I should really try their food out since I was craving hummus and falafel. As a group, we ordered lemon mint hookah, hummus/falafel plate, and onion rings. We also asked the person working for water as well. 

The ONLY thing I didn't like about this place is that they gave us a water bottle to charge us instead of just water on ice. I know it's for the business, but assumptions are a no go. 

The food was good, the portion was pretty good for a group of three. The pita bread was super fresh and hot when we received it too. The thing that got me to come back to this place is the fact that we could fix our hookah ourselves. The tongs were provided and the hookah hit great. Thick smoke is always the best and the flavor was just as good too AAAAAND the music was good and super chill. Such a plus. This place will probably be my go to spot for chill nights and hookah sessions. Highly recommend it to my friends and peers.
OMG. This place was so good! Food was bomb and the drink specials they have are pretty good compared to other places. I'll definitely be coming back soon. Making this my weekly spot for sure

I am picking up to go 2-4 times a week, hummus mushrooms, Layla mix, with onion rings, a salad and schnitzel for the kids, don't need to say more!
Love the food love the guys!
Hummus hummus hummus, to crave it!
Great place to smoke. Food outstanding...customer service on point.  Thanks Mono...hope I got his name right..

This place was the definition of unprofessional and mismanaged. We celebrated our friends birthday here and we brought a cake but before we brought the cake in we asked could we bring it in. One gentleman stated it was $10.00 for us to bring it in and we were okay with paying that. The second guy who stated he was the boss stopped us as we were approaching our friend to sing him happy birthday and took the cake from us blew out the candles himself and threw the cake away. Not only did he throw the cake away he took it out the trash can and tried to give it back to us and say that he didn't throw it. What were we going to do with a cake that was thrown in the trash. You wouldn't eat it or use it why would we. I should not have even given the 1 star because they don't deserve that much with how disrespectful the "boss" is. The guy who gave us the okay managed to give us cash back but the "boss" threw the money at my friend like she was the help.

Pretty decent place, the hookah is great and prices are decent. The music and vibe are good as well if you are looking for a laid back sort of evening. Servers and bartenders are usually attentive, BUT don't go on a night where they have reservations for large groups because you WILL get ignored.

Not a local but I been here a handful of times, in the times I have visited. First of their pita chicken shawarma with Israeli salad and hummus inside is literally the best shawarma I ever had. I cannot find a better or as equal shawarma in Northern California ( still searching). Their hookahs are great as well, never had an issue with it not hitting or having to call them over to fix it. They know what they are doing. I mainly come back here for the food! The customer service is great as well. They have never let me down even on their most busiest nights.

This place has great food !!!! Absolutely love it , only problem is there is always only 1 server and I feel like he can't handle it , takes a while to get our food every time we come in ... Food is excellent though !!! I would recommend it but definitely be prepared to wait a while for the food ....

The food here is great and the staff are a bunch of cool guys. Everybody here is awesome. Good vibes. I had a misinterpretation with one of the employees, although the owner contacted me and justified everything, apologizing for his actions and invited me back. Tuesday is karaoke night and it's very packed, you need to reserve a table fyi just to clarify!! But this is a great hookah lounge in southwest! 5/5
That's Giovanni, in the background, he's awesome. Nizan is the best shisha mixer around, easy on the eyes too. Love this place!!! Best shisha in town, open late and cheap drinks, and good music.
